text:
Hi, I am Iram,
I am currently studying 3 A levels in English literature, Mathematics and Biology. I plan to gain an accounting apprenticeship after Y13.

My future goals is to complete all ACCA exams and become an ACCA member.

To kickstart this conversation, I would like to ask you, How you ended up in the industry of Finance? 
What was your educational journey/career path like? 
What A levels did you study that has helped you in your career in finance? (What skills did you learn during your time studying for A levels).

Hello Iram,

I am really happy to be your mentor and I am hoping I will be able to help you. 

To answer your question, I ended up in Finance mainly because of my Mum:-). My parents had a restaurant and when I was about 13 year old she asked me to do her purchase book and her cash book:-)! Big books they were. I had no idea but I started doing it and I liked it. She also then asked me to bring the Cash of the restaurant at the bank because I was in college in the big City. I must have been 15 year old. She trusted me so that is something that stayed with me. 
My A levels were almost like yours: littérature, Mathematics and Economics. 
So I did not know yet at that time that it was going to be finance but I knew I wanted to go to a business school and I did not want to go to University. It had also to be International (I knew that as well). 
So it became an international business school. I had to take some loans because my parents did not have the money....
I will tell you later about ACCA.

How did you come to your choice? 
How do you know about ACCA??
Is school going ok??

Christèle
